page.title: 12Adult Recreation in Weston
page.content:
The oldest club in Weston is the {Womens Institute,}founded in 1920 and reformed in 1967. The group currently has 28 members. In addition to their monthly meetings with guest speakers members also enjoy craft and other activities and perform voluntary work. In 1984 the group produced a pageant of Weston through the Ages and in 1985 won the Oxfordshire Produce Shield.
Weston's senior citizens meet monthly during the winter at the{Get Together {Club.} Its 25 members, all aged 70 or over enjoy guest speakers, outings, tea parties and even an annual ceildh.
The Weston{Horticultural Society}was formed in 1963 and currently has 20 members aged between 16 and 76. The Society stages an Annual Show which attracted 500 entries this year.
